title: Sir Percival

properties.name: description
properties.value: Sir Percival was a knight of Camelot, and was part of King Arthur's Knights of the Round Table. While searching for a set of legendary artefacts called the "Golden Boots of Arkanesses," he was kidnapped by goblins in northern Asgarnia. He became their slave, and was thrust into a sack and forgotten for over a day. Percival is rescued during the Holy Grail quest and succeeds his father, The Fisher King, as new king of the Fisher Realm. It is not known what happens to the Fisher King, though it is implied that he passes away. After the quest, King Percival can be found on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the castle to the south of fairy ring code bjr.

Sir Percival was a knight of Camelot, and was part of King Arthur's Knights of the Round Table. While searching for a set of legendary artefacts called the "Golden Boots of Arkanesses," he was kidnapped by goblins in northern Asgarnia. He became their slave, and was thrust into a sack and forgotten for over a day. Percival is rescued during the Holy Grail quest and succeeds his father, The Fisher King, as new king of the Fisher Realm. It is not known what happens to the Fisher King, though it is implied that he passes away. After the quest, King Percival can be found on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of the castle to the south of fairy ring code bjr.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

King Percival is the solution to the hard cipher clue: VTYR APCNTGLW. The answer to his riddle is "5".

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • His name is a reference to a knight named Percival from Arthurian legend.
  • If you talk to Sir Percival after completing the quest in Goblin Village, you will ask "Aren't you supposed to be at the Grail Castle?", to which he will reply "You must have mistaken me with somebody else."

'''Sir Percival''' was a knight of [[Camelot]], and was part of [[King Arthur]]'s Knights of the Round Table. While searching for a set of legendary artefacts called the "Golden Boots of Arkanesses," he was kidnapped by goblins in northern [[Asgarnia]]. He became their slave, and was thrust into a sack and forgotten for over a day. Percival is rescued during the [[Holy Grail]] quest and succeeds his father, [[The Fisher King]], as new king of the [[Fisher Realm]]. It is not known what happens to the Fisher King, though it is implied that he passes away. After the quest, '''King Percival''' can be found on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of the castle to the south of fairy ring code {{Fairycode|bjr}}.

==Treasure Trails==
{{Cipher|King Percival|hard|VTYR APCNTGLW}}. The answer to his riddle is "5".

==Dialogue==
{{hastranscript|NPC}}

==Trivia==
*His name is a reference to a knight named ''{{wp|Percival}}'' from Arthurian legend.
*If you talk to Sir Percival after completing the quest in Goblin Village, you will ask "Aren't you supposed to be at the Grail Castle?", to which he will reply "You must have mistaken me with somebody else."
